thread.title: Rangers’ demanding Lundqvist plan coming into focus already
thread.title_full: Rangers’ demanding Lundqvist plan coming into focus already | New York Post

author: Larry Brooks
title: Rangers’ demanding Lundqvist plan coming into focus already
text:
COLUMBUS, Ohio — When Henrik Lundqvist starts Saturday’s home opener against the Blue Jackets after having gotten the call for Friday’s match against the same team, the King will have played as many back-to-backs as he did all last season.
The three straight starts to open the season after Friday’s 4-2 victory over the Jackets and Wednesday’s 3-2 victory in Chicago are part of the master plan to get Lundqvist off to the quick getaway coach Alain Vigneault has talked about since the day before training camp commenced.
“I had a long conversation with Benny [goaltending coach Benoit Allaire] about what plan he believed would be best for Hank,” Vigneault said after the Blueshirts practiced in Chicago before flying here.
“I think this is a good way to get Hank going and feeling good about his game.”
Lundqvist, who was excellent in the opening two-game sweep, last got back-to-back starts on Dec. 13 and Dec. 14 in Vancouver and Edmonton, allowing one goal in a victory over the Canucks and shutting out the Oilers. The King was limited to a career-low 46 starts overall last season, missing 21 games with the vascular injury he sustained on Jan. 31.
The previous year, Lundqvist started four sets of back-to-backs, going 1-3 with a 4.01 GAA on the second night of what was Vigneault’s first season behind the Blueshirts’ bench. The King started six sets of back-to-backs in the lockout-shortened 2012-13 season, five in 2011-12, 10 in 2010-11, seven in 2009-10, nine in 2008-09, 12 in 2007-08, 11 in 2006-07 and five in his rookie season of 2005-06.
Vigneault did not officially confirm Lundqvist as Saturday’s starter, but was unable to stifle laughter while going into his familiar refrain of, “If I were a betting man …”
Backup Antti Raanta is expected to get his first start as a Ranger for Tuesday’s match at the Garden against the Jets.
The lineup is likely to change for Saturday’s rematch after Tanner Glass, Emerson Etem and Dylan McIlrath all sat out for the second straight game.
